segments.content: Thanks for having this onboarding meeting. I've reviewed the roadmap, but I'd love to understand how everything fits together. What's our core focus for the hackathon demo?
segments.briefSummary: Muhammad asks about the focus for the hackathon demo.
detailedSummary: Muhammad expresses gratitude for the meeting.
He seeks clarification on the roadmap and hackathon focus.

segments.content: Great question, Muhammad. ParaGraph transforms meeting discussions into visual knowledge maps. Think of it as a dynamic way to understand team conversations. For the hackathon, we're focusing on three key components: ASR integration, visualization architecture, and insights generation. Kinan, want to walk us through the ASR part?
segments.briefSummary: Qi outlines the focus areas for the hackathon.
detailedSummary: Qi explains the purpose of ParaGraph in transforming discussions into visual maps.
He introduces the three components for the hackathon: ASR, visualization, and insights.

segments.content: Sure. We're using real-time speech processing with two key innovations. First, we're implementing speaker diarization to track who's talking when. Second, we're using topic detection to color-code different discussion themes. The challenge is maintaining accuracy while processing in real-time. Ewa, this connects directly to your visualization work, especially for the temporal flow view.
segments.briefSummary: Kinan discusses ASR innovations and their connection to visualization.
detailedSummary: Kinan describes the use of real-time speech processing.
He mentions speaker diarization and topic detection as key innovations.
He connects ASR to Ewa's visualization work.

segments.content: Exactly, Kinan. The temporal flow view is our first layer of visualization. I'm designing it to show speaker contributions as parallel lanes, with topic-based color coding. The key is making complex information instantly graspable. Muhammad, imagine uploading a meeting recording and immediately seeing how topics flow between speakers.
segments.briefSummary: Ewa explains the temporal flow view in visualization.
detailedSummary: Ewa describes the design of the temporal flow view.
She emphasizes the importance of making information easily understandable.

segments.content: That sounds powerful. How do we handle transitions between different visualization layers?
segments.briefSummary: Muhammad inquires about transitions in visualization layers.
detailedSummary: Muhammad expresses interest in the visualization design.
He asks how transitions between layers will be managed.

segments.content: Great point! We're using smooth morphing animations between views. When users switch from temporal flow to topic map, topics maintain their color coding but reorganize spatially to show relationships. Kinan, I'm curious - could we use the ASR confidence scores to adjust visualization opacity?
segments.briefSummary: Ewa discusses transition mechanics and proposes using ASR confidence scores.
detailedSummary: Ewa explains the use of animations for transitions.
She suggests using ASR confidence scores for visual adjustments.

segments.content: Interesting idea, Ewa! We could map confidence scores to visual properties. Actually, I've been thinking about topic detection too. Instead of fixed categories, we could dynamically generate topic clusters based on semantic similarity. Qi, this might help with your vision for knowledge graph generation.
segments.briefSummary: Kinan proposes dynamic topic detection for better clustering.
detailedSummary: Kinan supports Ewa's idea about confidence scores.
He suggests dynamic topic clustering based on semantic similarity.

segments.content: Absolutely! That ties into our bigger vision. Beyond just visualizing single meetings, we want to show how ideas evolve across multiple sessions. The knowledge graph becomes this living map of team expertise. Muhammad, you'll be helping us test these different visualization layers.
segments.briefSummary: Qi links topic detection to the broader vision of knowledge graphs.
detailedSummary: Qi outlines the vision for evolving ideas across meetings.
He describes the knowledge graph as a representation of team expertise.

segments.content: Should I focus on any specific aspect during testing?
segments.briefSummary: Muhammad asks about focus areas for testing.
detailedSummary: Muhammad seeks guidance on what to prioritize during testing.

segments.content: Focus first on the temporal flow view. Watch how topic transitions appear, check if the speaker lanes are clearly distinguished. Also, we're adding interactive features - hovering over a topic highlights related segments across speakers. Think about what would help you understand meeting content quickly.
segments.briefSummary: Ewa provides testing guidelines for the temporal flow view.
detailedSummary: Ewa suggests focusing on the temporal flow view during testing.
She mentions the addition of interactive features for better understanding.

segments.content: And while testing the ASR, pay attention to how well it handles technical terms. I'm implementing a domain-specific vocabulary system, but we need to balance accuracy with processing speed. Qi, should we prioritize real-time processing or accuracy for the demo?
detailedSummary: Kinan highlights the importance of handling technical terms in ASR.
He raises the question of prioritizing real-time processing versus accuracy.

segments.content: For the hackathon demo, let's prioritize accuracy. We can show real-time capabilities as a stretch goal. The key is demonstrating how ParaGraph makes meeting content more accessible and actionable. Ewa's visualization needs clean data to really shine.
segments.briefSummary: Qi prioritizes accuracy for the hackathon demo.
detailedSummary: Qi decides to prioritize accuracy for the demo.
He emphasizes the importance of clean data for effective visualization.

segments.content: Agreed. Clean data will help us showcase the core value proposition. Muhammad, we can start you with some pre-recorded test meetings to establish our baseline visualization performance.
segments.briefSummary: Ewa agrees on the importance of clean data and outlines next steps.
detailedSummary: Ewa reiterates the need for clean data.
She suggests starting with pre-recorded meetings for testing.

segments.content: Perfect. Let's wrap up with clear next steps. Muhammad, focus on temporal flow testing. Kinan, refine the ASR accuracy. Ewa, polish those view transitions. We'll sync again tomorrow to check progress.
segments.briefSummary: Qi wraps up the meeting with action items.
detailedSummary: Qi summarizes the next steps for each team member.
He sets a follow-up meeting to check on progress.
